intro: Calcearia insulifloris, commonly known as the island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the early morning. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual with slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calcearia insulifloris thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in coastal and island ecosystems.
